newsitem.title: CHINA: China cotton industry sees problems - official.
newsitem.headline: China cotton industry sees problems - official.

text.p: China's State Council, or cabinet, has decided not to throw open the cotton market, raw material prices or administration over cotton growing this year, Vice Premier Zhu Rongji said.

New problems involving cotton output, circulation and consumer demand reflected longstanding problems in the textile industry such as low levels of production, surplus production capacity, poor quality and outdated products, the People's Daily on Monday quoted Zhu as telling a conference.
This year, regions will form cotton trading associations that will replace the state allocation system, Zhu told the conference, which closed on Thursday.
Chinese officials have forecast this year's harvest at 3.8 million tonnes, down from 4.5 million last year, and compared with demand for 5.0 million tonnes.
Zhu urged finance, tax authorities and marketing cooperatives to seek ways to help textile mills overcome their problems to reactivate the industry.
All problems could be solved through further reforms, adjustments of the product mix and adopting comprehensive rectification measures.
